data.title: Visiting Tree House Deerfield — Tree House Brewing Company
data.meta_description: Information on visiting our incredibly scenic Deerfield taproom located right alongside I-91 in bucolic Western Massachusetts
data.text:
What a place

Tanglewood. Five Colleges. Norman Rockwell. Mohawk Trail. Bridge of Flowers. Peace Pagoda. Hilltowns. The Berkshires. Five Colleges. Mass MoCa. Susan B. Anthony Birthplace Museum. Montague Book Mill. Five Eyed Fox. Emily Dickinson Museum.

The Notch. Mount Greylock. Mount Skinner. Mount Tom. Mount Toby. Sugarloaf Mountain. The Sawtooth Range. Robert Frost Trail. Appalachian Trail. Bash Bish Falls. Deerfield River. The Mohawk Trail.

Basketball Hall of Fame. Six Flags. The Big E. Bright Nights. Yankee Candle. Kringle Candle. The Butterfly Observatory.

History. The arts. The outdoors. The people. The spirit.

Hello Western Mass, indeed.

Tree House is honored to occupy the bucolic stretch along Routes 5 &10 for Deerfield. We will add value to the experience of visiting the area by creating a centralized space for community and spirit where friends and families can unite to the taste of artfully crafted beverages and revel in the arts so central to life our sliver of the world.

We are open for cans to go and draft pours at Tree House Deerfield. Each day moving forward, our time will be actively working to make Tree House Deerfield a true gateway to Western Massachusetts - a place of community and diversity, a celebration of the arts, and a celebration of life. Thank you for reading. We look forward to seeing you soon.

Hello, Western Mass indeed.

Hiring + Jobs

Thus far, Tree House Western Mass employs 80 individuals, including our taproom manager and assistant taproom managers. We carry a great deal of pride to bring well-paying jobs to the Deerfield community now and in the future as we grow and evolve.

Check here for job openings, and if you are interested in applying to a position, please act quickly as they fill up fast.

Community Outreach

Tree House has a lengthy record of contributing to causes that affect the human condition from both a global perspective and a community perspective.

As part of our initial outreach, we are inviting community makers and creators to participate in a charitable undertaking whereby Tree House will purchase an artful good to be raffled to our guests, with 100% of the proceeds being donated to local charitable organizations. This will benefit both the creator and the charitable initiative while giving the lucky raffle winner something to cherish forever. If you are interested in this initiative, please email info@treehousebrew.com. Slots are limited, so please consider reaching out quickly for consideration by our team.

Our first item, currently under construction, is a Healer Electric Guitar made by Trevor Healy of Healy Guitars in Easthampton, Massachusetts. We will not spoil the surprise, but if you enjoy playing and you enjoy Tree House we are certain that this is a raffle that you will want to participate in!

In addition to this initiative, a portion of the proceeds from Hello Western Mass has been donated to Dakin Human Society, Western Mass Hilltown Hikers, Magic Wings Butterfly Conservatory, Community Foundation of Western Mass, Baystate Health Foundation, Food Bank of Western Massachusetts, and Community Involved In Sustaining Agriculture.

In closing

As a team full of outdoor enthusiasts, this spot in Deerfield is ideally situated near activities like rafting or fly fishing on the Deerfield River, hiking at Mount Toby and Mount Sugarloaf State Reservation, cycling the flats of Route 5 and the hills of the Mohawk Trail, mountain biking at Thunder Mountain bike park, skiing at Berkshire East, and so much more. Further, it’s situated at a pleasant jump-off point for engaging cultural attractions like the Bridge Of Flowers, the Butterfly Conservatory, Yankee Candle Flagship Store, the Five Colleges, Historic Deerfield, downtown Amherst, and Northampton, and a bit further out, Mass MoCA, Mount Greylock, and the varying charm and intrigue of the Hilltowns.

Our roots are deep in the fabric of Massachusetts, and more broadly, New England, and calling this gorgeous sliver of the Pioneer Valley home fills us with pride and purpose to do even better on your behalf.

The long-term vision for Tree House Western Mass is to curate a gathering space for friends, families, and groups to celebrate life, the arts, and each other. We will build extraordinary spaces, curate exceptional art, curate exceptional food, and drink, and do whatever we have to to make Tree House Western Mass a cultural destination worthy of the region in which it resides. Thank you for reading, and have an excellent day.
